cbccore.low
Class Create

java.lang.Object
  cbccore.low.Create

public class Create
extends java.lang.Object

Direct access to the CBC-C Create Libraries

Documentation stolen from the KISS-C documentation and the cbc source code

Author:
Braden McDorman
See Also:
Create, DriveTrain, CreateMovementPlugin

Constructor Detail

Create

public Create()
Method Detail

create_connect

public int create_connect()
First step for connecting CBC to Create. This function puts the Create in the create_safe mode.

Returns:
0 if sucessful and a negative number if not
See Also:
create_disconnect()

create_disconnect

public void create_disconnect()
Returns Create to proper state. Call this at the end of your program.

See Also:
create_connect()

create_start

public void create_start()
Puts Create into passive mode (no motors)

See Also:
create_passive(), create_safe(), create_full(), create_mode()

create_passive

public void create_passive()
Puts Create into passive mode (no motors)

See Also:
create_start(), create_safe(), create_full(), create_mode()

create_safe

public void create_safe()
Puts Create into safe mode. Create will execute all commands, but will disconnect and stop if drop or cliff sensors fire. This is recommended for practice, but not at a tournament.

See Also:
create_passive(), create_full(), create_mode()

create_full

public void create_full()
Puts Create into full mode. Create will move however you tell it -- even if that is a bad thing. In particular, the Create will not stop and disconnect, even if it is picked up or the cliff sensors fire. This is recommended for tournaments, but not for practice, due to its dangerous nature.

See Also:
create_passive(), create_safe(), create_mode()

create_spot

public void create_spot()
Simulates a Roomba doing a spot clean

See Also:
create_cover(), create_demo(int), create_cover_dock()

create_cover

public void create_cover()
Simulates a Roomba covering a room

See Also:
create_spot(), create_demo(int), create_cover_dock()

create_demo

public void create_demo(int d)
Runs built in demos (see Create IO documentation)

Parameters:
d - See Create IO documentation. I would normally look this up, but it seems so pointless...
See Also:
create_spot(), create_cover(), create_cover_dock()

create_cover_dock

public void create_cover_dock()
Create roams around until it sees an IR dock and then attempts to dock

See Also:
create_spot(), create_cover(), create_demo(int)

create_mode

public int create_mode()
the Create's mode

Returns:
0 off; 1 passive; 2 safe; 3 full
See Also:
create_passive(), create_safe(), create_full()

create_stop

public void create_stop()
Stops the drive wheels

create_drive

public void create_drive(int speed,
                         int radius)
Drives in an arc.

Parameters:
speed - range is 20-500mm/s
radius - radius in mm/s.

A radius of 32767 will drive the robot straight.

A radius of 1 will spin the robot CCW

A radius of -1 will spin the robot CW

Negative radii will be right turns, positive radii left turns

See Also:
create_drive_straight(int)

create_drive_straight

public void create_drive_straight(int speed)
Drives straight at speed in mm/s

Parameters:
speed - 20-500mm/s

create_spin_CW

public void create_spin_CW(int speed)
Spins CW with edge speed of speed in mm/s

Parameters:
speed - 20-500mm/s. Speed of edge (wheels) of bot.
See Also:
create_spin_CCW(int)

create_spin_CCW

public void create_spin_CCW(int speed)
Spins CCW with edge speed of speed in mm/s

Parameters:
speed - 20-500mm/s. Speed of edge (wheels) of bot.
See Also:
create_spin_CW(int)

create_drive_direct

public void create_drive_direct(int r_speed,
                                int l_speed)
Specifies individual left and right speeds in mm/s

Parameters:
r_speed - 20-500mm/s. Speed of right wheel.
l_speed - 20-500mm/s. Speed of left wheel.
See Also:
create_drive(int, int)

create_spin_block

public int create_spin_block(int speed,
                             int angle)
This function blocks and does a pretty accurate spin. Note that the function will not return until the spin is complete CAUTION: requesting the robot to spin more than about 3600 degrees may never terminate

Parameters:
speed - 20-500mm/s. Speed of edge (wheels) of bot.
angle - Angle in degrees to turn before returning.

CAUTION: requesting thce robot to spin more than about 3600 degrees may never terminate

Returns:
-1 if error
See Also:
create_spin_CW(int), create_spin_CCW(int)

create_advance_led

public void create_advance_led(int on)
Turn on/off the advance LED

Parameters:
on - 1 to turn on light and 0 to turn it off
See Also:
create_play_led(int), create_power_led(int, int)

create_play_led

public void create_play_led(int on)
Turn on/off the play LED

Parameters:
on - 1 to turn on light and 0 to turn it off
See Also:
create_advance_led(int), create_power_led(int, int)

create_power_led

public void create_power_led(int color,
                             int brightness)
Control the color and the brightness of the power LED

Parameters:
color - 0 is red and 255 green
brightness - 0 is off and 255 is full brightness
See Also:
create_advance_led(int), create_play_led(int)

create_digital_output

public void create_digital_output(int bits)
This function sets the three digital out put pins 20,7,19 where 20 is the high bit and 19 is the low. You probably don't care about this function.

Parameters:
bits - Should have a value 0 to 7.

create_pwm_low_side_drivers

public void create_pwm_low_side_drivers(int pwm2,
                                        int pwm1,
                                        int pwm0)
Sets the PWM signal for the three low side drivers (128 = 100%). You probably don't care about this function.

Parameters:
pwm0 - pin 22
pwm1 - pin 23
pwm2 - pin 24

create_low_side_drivers

public void create_low_side_drivers(int pwm2,
                                    int pwm1,
                                    int pwm0)
Turns on and off the signal for the three low side drivers (128 = 100%). A 0 or 1 should be given for each of the drivers to turn them off or on. You probably don't care about this function.

Parameters:
pwm0 - pin 22
pwm1 - pin 23
pwm2 - pin 24

create_load_song

public void create_load_song(int num)
This loads a song into the robot's memory. Song can be numbered 0 to 15. The first element in each row of the array should be the number of notes (1-16) the subsequent pairs of bytes should be tone and duration see the roomba SCI manual for note codes. User's program should load the song data into the array before calling this routine. Sets gc_song_array, an inaccessable variable. DO NOT USE THIS FUNCTION UNTIL THE ISSUE IS RESOLVED

Parameters:
num - Song can be numbered 0 to 15
See Also:
create_play_song(int)

create_play_song

public void create_play_song(int num)
See the roomba SCI manual for note codes. Uses gc_song_array, an inaccessable variable. DO NOT USE THIS FUNCTION UNTIL THE ISSUE IS RESOLVED

Parameters:
num - Song can be numbered 0 to 15
See Also:
create_load_song(int)

                             int count)

public void create_write_byte(char write_byte)
See Create IO Documentation. You probably don't care about this function.
